column4: alright so my Firefox installation is broken and its effecting synaptic, update manager.. this is the error i'm getting "E: /var/cache/apt/archives/firefox_1.5.dfsg+1.5.0.7-0ubuntu5.10.3_i386.deb: error creating symbolic link `./usr/bin/firefox'

2006-10-13T08:46:00.000Z	bruenig	kyle__	do file /usr/bin/firefox and post the output
2006-10-13T08:47:00.000Z	bruenig	kyle__	open a terminal and do this file /usr/bin/firefox" tell me what it says...
and after that
sweet
that should fix firefox also
I would assume that the /usr/lib/firefox directory is messed up
see if there is anything in the firefox lib directory, ls /usr/lib/firefox/
there's a bunch of stuff in that folder
do /usr/lib/firefox/firefox
it does nothing
do "file /usr/lib/firefox/firefox"
what was the output for file /usr/lib/firefox/firefox
/usr/lib/firefox/firefox: Bourne shell script text executable
that is odd, how the symbolic link could be broken, I have no idea. It is there, the symbolic link shouldn't be broken.
thanks
when you did ls /usr/lib/firefox, were there 33 things listed?

yes... what happened i think is.. i was following the instructions for installing the NewVersion of firefox from the ubuntu.org wiki and something went wrong so i never got 1.5.0.4 .. 0.7 installed and now 1.0.7 isn't working
you are using breezy?
so i was instructed to upgrade to dapper, that's when i found out the symbollic link error
ah, well, these were all intended for dapper. I don't remember breezy well enough to instruct that. I assume they would be similar but perhaps not
do you know any instructions for upgrading to dapper
